title: Which was the best car of 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: One built in the U.S., we build Mercedes-Benz, Honda, Toyota, Mazda, and Hyundai here in Alabama. As a “Right to Work” state, we have attracted these companies here. The new $1.6 Billion Toyota plant will hire up to 4,500 workers, and built up to 350,000 SUV’s a year. FIAT builds it’s Chrysler products in Brampton, Ontario and Saltillo, Mexico. Ford will only be building Mustangs this year. UAW Motors, was GM, is now owned by the United Auto Workers, so I won’t buy those. Maybe we can get Tesla to move here also? California only has one auto manufacturer left, Tesla. Michigan only builds Jeeps and Ram trucks according to Google? Who’d have thought Alabama would build more vehicles that Michigan? More accomplishments by the Democrats?

There is no Best Car. I love my Cadillac Escalade ESV, it will do many things that a Veyron can’t, nowhere close, but it isn’t going to show up on very many people’s list of Best Cars. Then one must consider such factors as reliability, longevity, freedom from routine maintenance demands, and cost of ownership.
